intro: Nectandra schomburgkii, commonly known as the yellow sand-wood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, dark-colored wood and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
